page.title: 05LANDSCAPE ALLERTHORPE COMMON
page.content: LANDSCAPE. ALLERTHORPE COMMON. WOODLAND;Dominantly Deciduous Trees & Conifers. Area of 525 acres, Scrubland Birch & Thorrn also planted with conifers by Forestry Commission. Area designated "Site of Special Scientific Interest". Parts of the Common administered by naturalist trust. Reached from the village of Allerthorpe by a path listed on maps as a public-footpath or bridleway, in point of fact it is wide enough for a 4 wheeled vehicle.It is a dirt road, with large water filled holes. Bridleways cross the Common from West to East to Centre. This common land was under the jurisdiction of the "Lord of the Manor", for the villagers to graze their sheep & cattle. The people of Allerthorpe no longer need grazing land.Shooting Rights are controlled by local farmers.
